articles.title: Rise of educational expenses rejected in S. Korea
articles.content:
Rise of educational expenses rejected in S. Korea 
    Pyongyang, January 20 (KCNA) -- General student councils of 15 South Korean universities called a press conference at Seoul National University on Jan. 16 demanding the Ministry of Education withdraw its measure for 5 percent hike of tuition fee and entrance fee and freeze the registration fee, according to Seoul-based Yonhap News (internet).
 Referring to the fact that the ministry raised the registration fee over two times higher than the price hike rate in 1995 and 1996 and much higher than the one in 1997, the councils rejected its measure.

articles.title: Korea's reunification supported
articles.content:
Korea's reunification supported
    Pyongyang, January 20 (KCNA) -- The Indian center of trade unions in a statement expressed its support and solidarity with the Korean people in their struggle to reunify the country, on behalf of its 3 million members.
 It was issued on January 13 to support an appeal to the 70 million fellow countrymen adopted at the 2001 meeting for independent reunification of the Korean nation.   
 Expressing full support to the appeal, the statement sincerely welcomed the joint appeal adopted at the grand seminar of workers in the north and the south for reunification held in December 200

articles.title: Preparatory committee inaugurated
articles.content:
Preparatory committee inaugurated
    Pyongyang, January 20 (KCNA) -- An inaugural meeting of a preparatory committee was held in Kinshasa on January 13 to celebrate the birthday of leader Kim Jong Il which will fall on February 16.
 Otete Gaston Mboyo, national chairman of the national movement of the Genuine Lumumbist Combatants of the Democratic Republic of Congo, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee at the meeting.    
 The committee set the period from January 13 to February 20 as a celebration period and decided to hold colourful functions including meeting, lecture and film show.

DPRK SPA delegation leaves for Cambodia
articles.content:
DPRK SPA delegation leaves for Cambodia
    Pyongyang, January 20 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK led by its vice-chairman Jang Chol left here today to attend a meeting of the "Asian Parliamentary Association for Peace" to be held in Phnom Penh.
 The delegation was seen off at the airport by Ryo Won Gu, vice-chairperson of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, and Oum Mannorine, Cambodian ambassador to the DPRK.
